hanzi-su-wiki:
憂

Значения

Печаль; горевать; несчастный, печальный

Мнемоника

Печаль можно одолеть 夂 силой разума. Голова 頁 и сердце 心 устроены по разному и, поэтому, разделены элементом покров 冖.

Варианты

忧
purpleculture_pinyin:
yōu
to worry; to concern oneself with; worried; anxiety; sorrow; (literary) to observe mourning
волноваться; заботиться о себе; волновался; беспокойство; печаль; (литературный) соблюдать траур
rtega_mnemonic:
憂憂RS
忧忧		sad, grieved, grief, melancholy
  • RS. a person 頁 who walks 夊 with the heart 心 showing
  • ⓢ having a heart 心 like a dog 尤
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 忧)
Antonyms: 樂
Pictophonetic: 頁 indicates the sound; 忄 (heart) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: In order to play up his worried feelings Hamlet bares his head and holds his crown over his heart. Then he walks (on walking legs) around the palace making everyone see how melancholy he is. What a wuss.
heisig_constituent: melancholy, summer, head, page, crown, heart, walking legs
heisig_story: Head . . . crown . . . heart . . . walking legs. Two things merit mention here. First, the doubling-up of the last stroke of head with the top of the crown serves to make the whole more aesthetically beautiful. It happens so rarely that the exceptions are easily learned. Second, try to make a single image out of the four elements. (Religious statuary of melancholy figures should offer plenty of suggestions.)
Keyword_KANJIDIC: melancholy, grieve, lament, be anxious, sad, unhappy
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: меланхолии, горевать, сокрушаться, заботьтесь, грустный, несчастный
koohiiStory1: Melancholy makes me think of Hamlet cause he was so ´emo´. In order to play up his feelings he bares his head and holds his crown over his heart then walks (on walking legs) around the palace making everyone see how melancholy he is. What a wuss.
koohiiStory2: This is an image of the crucifixion. Jesus is on the cross. His crown of thorns has slipped down and is around his neck, right between his head and his heart. His walking legs can be seen dangling from the cross as well. How MELANCHOLY!
kunYomi: うれ.える、うれ.い、う.い、う.き
jp_example_words: 憂鬱(ゆううつ): depression, melancholy, dejection, gloom
jp_readingExamples: 憂い (う.い), 憂い (うれ.い), 憂える (うれ.える)
WaniKani_Radicals: 百, 冖, 心, 夂
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A hundred foreheads lower themselves to their hearts in winter in grief. There were once many of their kind, the forehead peoples, but now there are only a hundred left after this harsh winter took the rest of them. Their grief is immense.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine if winter was so brutal that there were only one hundred human foreheads left. You lost all of your friends and family. Feel that grief.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Their grief intensifies because all of the foreheads they lost belonged to youths (ゆう). Dead youths everywhere. Now there's no one left to repopulate the world.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Grief for youths is so painful. No one should have to bury their forehead child.
Ru_Meaning: melancholy, grieve, lament, be anxious, sad, unhappy
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 冖 (ва), 夂 (зима), 心 (сердце), 白 (белый), 自 (сам)
Ru_trainchinese: yōu: (графема) беспокоиться, тревожиться; беспокойство, тревога; (книжн.) похороны родителей
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the heart (心) in the middle of summer (夏) grieves
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A chihuahua is a small little dog which gets a worried state of mind easily.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions started from " page " from " hand ", covering the face with hands, expressing worry and depression. Later, from " page " from " heart ", I wrote " 𢝊 ", which is the same as the ancient prose of " sorrow ". " Page " looks like a human and protrudes the head and face. It will show the meaning of worry and sadness on the face; Xu Kai: "𢝊 shaped on the face, So from the page." The original meaning is worry, worry.

" Worry ", " 𢝊 ", and " 𢚧 " are really one word, "Shuowen": "Worry, and the journey of harmony. From the sound of 夊𢚧. "Poetry" said: "Political worry about worry."" "Shuwen" ": "𢝊, worry also. From the heart from the page." Zhu Junsheng: "The scriptures are all based on worry, and the word 𢝊 is abolished." "Erya. "Explanation of the Second": "Worry, think about it." Xing Bingshu: "Worry, think about it."

When it comes to " worry ", one should save the sound from " heart " and "夒", and add heart to the evolution of the word "夒" (Gao Yuanjin). The inscription "夒" under the guise of " worry ", see "夒".

Jin Wen expressed concern, and Mao Gongding said, "I am worried about the King of Fuchsia." Zhongshan Wang Ding: "With 𢝊 (worry) Lao Bangjia", [妾子] 𧊒 pot: "Take a big punishment, with 𢝊 (worry) and the people's innocence (only)." It means to vigorously exempt from punishment, With worry and compassion for the innocent people.

The word " worry " in Mawangdui's silk is derived from " Xia " and " Heart ", and the word " Xia " is used as " worry ". See also " Xia " and " 𢝊 ".
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription starts from " page " from " hand ", covering the face with hands, expressing depression. The original meaning is worry, worry.
humanum_full_description:
金文最初從「頁」從「手」，以手遮蓋臉面，表示憂心忡忡，心情愁悶。後來從「頁」從「心」，寫作「𢝊」，與「憂」古文同，「頁」象人形而突出頭臉，會憂思愁緒展現於顏面之意；徐鍇：「𢝊形於颜面，故从頁。」本義是擔心、擔憂。

　　「憂」、「𢝊」、「𢚧」實乃一字，《說文》：「憂，和之行也。从夊𢚧聲。《詩》曰：『布政憂憂。』」《說文》：「𢝊，愁也。从心从頁。」朱駿聲：「經傳皆以憂為之，而𢝊字廢矣。」《爾雅．釋詁下》：「憂，思也。」邢昺疏：「憂者，愁思也。」

　　一說「憂」應從「心」，「夒」省聲，為「夒」字的演變而加心旁(高源縉)。金文「夒」假借作「憂」，參見「夒」。

　　金文表示憂慮，毛公鼎：「我弗乍先王憂」。中山王鼎：「以𢝊（憂）勞邦家」，[妾子]𧊒壺：「大去型罰，以𢝊（憂）氒民之隹（唯）不辜。」意謂大力免除刑罰，以憂心、體恤無罪的人民。

　　馬王堆帛書「憂」字從「夏」、「心」，又有省去心旁，借「夏」為「憂」，參見「夏」、「𢝊」。
humanum_short_description: 金文最初從「頁」從「手」，以手掩面，表示心情愁悶。本義是擔心、擔憂。

憂鬱(ゆううつ): depression, melancholy, dejection, gloom

金文最初從「 頁 」從「 手 」，以手遮蓋臉面，表示憂心忡忡，心情愁悶。後來從「 頁 」從「 心 」，寫作「 𢝊 」，與「 憂 」古文同，「 頁 」象人形而突出頭臉，會憂思愁緒展現於顏面之意；徐鍇：「𢝊形於颜面，故从頁。」本義是擔心、擔憂。 「 憂 」、「 𢝊 」、「 𢚧 」實乃一字，《說文》：「憂，和之行也。从夊𢚧聲。《詩》曰：『布政憂憂。』」《說文》：「𢝊，愁也。从心从頁。」朱駿聲：「經傳皆以憂為之，而𢝊字廢矣。」《爾雅．釋詁下》：「憂，思也。」邢昺疏：「憂者，愁思也。」 一說「 憂 」應從「 心 」，「 夒 」省聲，為「 夒 」字的演變而加心旁(高源縉)。金文「 夒 」假借作「 憂 」，參見「 夒 」。 金文表示憂慮，毛公鼎：「我弗乍先王憂」。中山王鼎：「以𢝊（憂）勞邦家」，[妾子]𧊒壺：「大去型罰，以𢝊（憂）氒民之隹（唯）不辜。」意謂大力免除刑罰，以憂心、體恤無罪的人民。 馬王堆帛書「 憂 」字從「 夏 」、「 心 」，又有省去心旁，借「 夏 」為「 憂 」，參見「 夏 」、「 𢝊 」。
Bronze inscriptions started from " page" from " hand", covering the face with hands, expressing worry and depression. Later, from " page" from " heart", I wrote " 𢝊", which is the same as the ancient prose of " sorrow". " Page" looks like a human and protrudes the head and face. It will show the meaning of worry and sadness on the face; Xu Kai: "𢝊 shaped on the face, So from the page." The original meaning is worry, worry. " Worry", " 𢝊", and " 𢚧" are really one word, "Shuowen": "Worry, and the journey of harmony. From the sound of 夊𢚧. "Poetry" said: "Political worry about worry."" "Shuwen" ": "𢝊, worry also. From the heart from the page." Zhu Junsheng: "The scriptures are all based on worry, and the word 𢝊 is abolished." "Erya. "Explanation of the Second": "Worry, think about it." Xing Bingshu: "Worry, think about it." When it comes to " worry", one should save the sound from " heart" and " 夒", and add heart to the evolution of the word " 夒" (Gao Yuanjin). The inscription " 夒" under the guise of " worry", see " 夒". Jin Wen expressed concern, and Mao Gongding said, "I am worried about the King of Fuchsia." Zhongshan Wang Ding: "With 𢝊 (worry) Lao Bangjia", [妾子] 𧊒 pot: "Take a big punishment, with 𢝊 (worry) and the people's innocence (only)." It means to vigorously exempt from punishment, With worry and compassion for the innocent people. The word " worry" in Mawangdui's silk is derived from " Xia" and " Heart", and the word " Xia" is used as " worry". See also " Xia" and " 𢝊".

憂字的基本解释

憂
yōu
见“忧”。

憂字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yōu］
［《廣韻》於求切，平尤，影。］
亦作“懮2”。“忧1”的繁体字。
(1)忧愁；忧虑。
(2)忧患；祸患。
(3)畏惧。
(4)疾病。
(5)居丧。多指居父母丧。
(6)谓军队为敌所败。
(7)通“優”。优厚。
(8)通“優”。戏谑。参见“憂謔”。

憂字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　憂； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页401第26
〔古文〕??【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】於求切【正韻】於尤切。本作?。今作憂。【說文】愁也。【爾雅·釋詁】思也。【疏】憂者。愁思也。【書·洪範】六極，三曰憂。　又疾也。【禮·曲禮】某有負薪之憂。【註】憂或爲疾。　又幽也。【易·乾卦】憂則違之。【註】謂時當幽隱也。　又辱也。【易·繫辭】小人道憂也。　又居喪曰憂。【書·說命】王宅憂。　又孕病曰憂。【晉語】文王在母不憂。　又人憂則頭低垂。【禮·曲禮】下于帶則憂。【註】憂則低也。　又幽憂曰癙憂。【詩·小雅】癙憂以痒。【周禮·春官·大宗伯】以凶禮哀邦國之憂。　又姓。出【姓苑】。　又【韻會】烏侯切，音謳。義同。【集韻】作㥑。　又【集韻】【韻會】?於救切。【集韻】慮也。詩序，百姓見憂。徐邈讀。　又叶於希切，音衣。【易林】不見叔姫，使伯心憂。　又叶衣虛切，音於。【易林】出入休居，安止無憂。【黃庭經】三神之樂由隱居，倏忽遊遨無遺憂。　又叶伊姚切，音妖。【三略】士可下而不可驕，將可樂而不可憂。　又叶一笑切，音要。【詩·王

[①]［yōu］
["Guangyun" Yu Qiuqi, Pingyou, Ying. ]
Also known as "懮2". The traditional characters of "忧1".
(1) Worry; worry.
(2) Worries; disasters.
(3) Fear.
(4) Disease.
(5) Bereavement. Mostly refers to the bereavement of the parents.
(6) The army was defeated by the enemy.
(7) Through "excellent". generous.
(8) Through "excellent". Joking. See "Worry".

Name meaning

yōu
вм. 忧
Radicals: 百, 冖, 心, 夂  (hundred, forehead, heart, winter)
Meaning Mnemonic
A hundred foreheads lower themselves to their hearts in winter in grief. There were once many of their kind, the forehead peoples, but now there are only a hundred left after this harsh winter took the rest of them. Their grief is immense.
Imagine if winter was so brutal that there were only one hundred human foreheads left. You lost all of your friends and family. Feel that grief.
Reading Mnemonic
Their grief intensifies because all of the foreheads they lost belonged to youths (ゆう). Dead youths everywhere. Now there's no one left to repopulate the world.
Grief for youths is so painful. No one should have to bury their forehead child.
